elements.title: Industrial Electronic Engineers
elements.contents: ... that Industrial Electronic Engineers' nimo tube (example pictured) contained ten electron guns firing through a number-shaped stencil?

elements.title: Madeleine Chapman
elements.contents: ... that New Zealand editor and journalist Madeleine Chapman, known for fashion label exposés and snack food ranking lists, is a champion javelin thrower?

elements.title: the pilot episode
elements.contents: ... that John Wesley Shipp, who played the Flash in the 1990 television series, was cast as his father in the pilot episode of 2014's The Flash?

elements.title: William Thomas
elements.contents: ... that as part of his work as an antiquary, William Thomas visited every church in Worcestershire?

elements.title: KMEX-TV
elements.contents: ... that after Los Angeles Spanish-language TV station KMEX-TV discovered that 15 percent of its viewers did not know the language, it added Spanish courses to its programming?

elements.title: Valeriy Chybineyev
elements.contents: ... that Valeriy Chybineyev was honored as a Hero of Ukraine in 2016 for his actions during the war in Donbas?

elements.title: Royal Expedition
elements.contents: ... that supplies were so poor during the Royal Expedition of the First Carlist War that some soldiers wore cardboard-heeled shoes?

elements.title: Feng Xuefeng
elements.contents: ... that Chinese writer Feng Xuefeng rewrote his 500,000-character manuscript, lost after he was captured by the Nationalists—only for him to burn it himself?
